description: Mahadev Temple, Tambdi Surla is a 12th-century Shaivite temple of the Lord Mahadeva and an active place of Hindu worship. It is notable as the oldest temple in Goa, India.The temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is reminiscent of the temples at Aihole in neighbouring Karnataka. There is a linga (symbol of Lord Shiva) mounted on a pedestal inside the inner sanctum, and local legend has it that a huge king cobra is in permanent residence in the dimly lit interior.
name: Mahadeva Temple

description: The Our Lady of the Immaculate Conception Church (Nossa Senhora da Immaculada Conceição), the colonial Portuguese Baroque style church was first built in 1541 as a chapel on a hill side overlooking the city of Panjim. The Festival of Our Lady of the Immaculate Conception is  held every year on 8 December, the church is colourfully illuminated.
name: Our Lady of the Immaculate Conception Church

description: In 1560 Ibrahim Adilshah of Bijapur built the Shahouri Masjid in Ponda Taluka, which is the biggest and most famous of the Mosques. Adjacent to the Mosque, there is a well-constructed masonry tank with small chambers with 'meharab' designs. The Mosque and the tank were formerly surrounded by an extensive garden with many fountains. The two major festivals Id-Ul-Fitr and Id-Ul-Zuha are celebrated at this mosque with great pomp and are attended by a large number of people every year.
name: Safa Masjid

description: The premises of the temple also acts like a dharamshala which provides facilities like pure vegetarian food and cozy accommodation options. The deity in the sanctum of the temple is made up of white marble which appears to resonate peaceful vibes all around. The only Jain temple in Goa, 1008 Adinath Digambar Jain Mandir is an ideal place for all Jain vacationers.
name: 1008 Shri Adinath Digambar Jain Mandir

description: It is also known as the Shri Mahalasa Narayani Temple and is dedicated to the Goddess Mahalasa. She is worshipped in two distinct traditions. As an independent goddess, she is considered as a form of Mohini -the female avatar of the god Vishnu and is called Mahalasa Narayani.  Jatra Mahotsav (Magh Mahotsav) is a popular festival celebrated at Mahalasa Temple. Held in February, it is also called the Mardol Jatra.
name: Mahalasa Temple

description: One of Goa's finest creations is the Mae De Deus Church. The immaculate white Mae De Deus Church of Saligao has the typical pointed arch, with buttresses supporting its exteriors, belfry, and spikes all so arranged to create a wonderful and first piece of Gothic architecture - the only one of its kind in the whole of Goa. It is not only the pride of Saligaonkars, but for us Goenkars too.
name: Mae De Deus Church

description: This mosque is quite close to the old ferry point. Though the very structure of the mosque doesn't look too old but a water tank, made in the front tells the history. This water tank has four steps on all its sides and has beautiful Mihrab arched architecture, all around its boundary.
name: Surla Taar Mosque

description: This was built and established in 1993 and dedicated to the Lord Ganesh, the Ganeshpuri Temple is a fine example of mannerism neo architectural style and a notable communal harmony among the people of Ganeshpuri. The area where the temple is situated is blessed with natural beauty, with lush green caju groves surrounding the hilly area.
name: Ganeshpuri Temple
